attributes.action: refuse a state funeral for Lady Thatcher and to stop any ceremonial acknowledgement of her death.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We acknowledge Lady Thatcher’s achievement as the first woman to serve as Prime Minister, but feel that this is insufficient to accord her a state or ceremonial funeral.

We draw attention to the economic destruction that Lady Thatcher’s policies wrought on our country, including record inflation, high interest rates and devastating rates of unemployment. 

We also note the decimation of communities across the country as a direct result of Lady Thatcher’s policies, and we note that many communities have still not recovered the economic prosperity they enjoyed before her intervention.

Given that others who have received state funerals have defended working people from conquerors and that Lady Thatcher sought only to conquer working people, we believe that any state funeral for her would taint the value of the state funeral.

We particularly note that Lady Thatcher claimed there was “no such thing as society”, and as such we believe that society has no place in formally acknowledging her death.
